field.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass
field.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a view of green fields and rolling hills
field.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a subject that people study or an area of activity that they are involved in as part of their work
field.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Peter’s an expert in his field.
He’s the best-known American outside the field of (=not connected with) politics.
her work in the field of human rights
field.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an area of ground where sports are played
field.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The team have had a bad year, both on and off the field.
Fans cheered as the players took the field (=went onto the field).
field.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: work or study that is done in the field is done in the real world rather than in a class or laboratory
field.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: His theories have not yet been tested in the field.
field.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: all the people, companies, products etc that are competing against each other
field.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: the field of candidates for the election
Germany was leading the field with a figure of 53%.
field.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: all the horses or runners in a race
field.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Prince led the field (=was ahead of the others) as they came around the final bend.
field.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: in a computer document, an amount of space made available for a particular type of information
field.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: an empty field  (=not yet written in)
field.translation[0].note_box[0].section: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + field
a corn/wheat/rice etc field
In summer the rice fields were lush and green.
an open field
I saw a fox run across the open field.
a green field
All around the house were green fields and rolling hills.
an arable field
Barley was growing in the arable fields surrounding the castle.
a cultivated field
The valley is an area of lush greenery and cultivated fields.
a ploughed field
It was difficult walking across the ploughed field.
a field of corn/wheat/rice etc
The road was surrounded by fields of corn.
plough a field
The farmer was using a tractor to plough the field.
work in the fields
Most villagers work in the fields during the day.
cross a field
We crossed the field and came to the barn.
walk across a field
I walked across the field to the gate.
cows/horses etc graze in a field
Cattle were grazing in the field below.
field.translation[0].note_box[1].section: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass
Cows were grazing in the field.
a field with wild grass and flowers
a small field in which horses are kept
Horses are much happier in a big paddock with several other horses.
land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
large areas of rough upland pasture
field.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if you field a team, an army etc, they represent you or fight for you in a competition, election, or war
field.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: We fielded a team of highly talented basketball players.
field.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to answer questions, telephone calls etc, especially when there are a lot of them or the questions are difficult
field.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The Minister fielded questions on the Middle East.
The press office fielded numerous calls from the media.
field.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: if you field the ball in a game of cricket or baseball, you stop it after it has been hit
field.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a British magazine which has articles about the countryside, farming, and sports such as polo and cricket. Most people in the UK think The Field is read by rich people who live in the country or own a lot of land there.
field.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a subject that people study or are involved in as part of their work
field.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: We are looking for graduates with degrees in artificial intelligence, languages and related fields.
Until recently, NEC was alone in the field of wireless communication.
field.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: studies, testing etc that are done in the field are done in the real world rather than in a LABORATORY, factory etc
field.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: We need someone who can test the drilling machinery in the field.
field.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: a large area where coal, oil etc is found
field.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: Even the largest oil corporations have to rely on external finance to develop new oil fields.
field.translation[3].definitions[3].defi: a space made available for a particular kind of information
field.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: to deal with a question, enquiry, telephone call etc, usually successfully
field.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: He fielded several angry calls from franchisees asking for their money back.
